result.markdown:
--- title: "Bupa Great Yorkshire Run" date: "2011-10-13" author: "Adrian Joseph" image: https://storage.googleapis.com/blogs_josa/sport_small/2011-10-13_BUPA_GREAT_YORKSHIRE_RUN/img/01.png categories: [race report, run] format: html lightbox: match: auto effect: fade desc-position: right loop: false --- ![](https://storage.googleapis.com/blogs_josa/sport_small/2011-10-13_BUPA_GREAT_YORKSHIRE_RUN/img/01.png) This was another one of my home races, in Sheffield, UK. The starting line was in city center, near the Crucible.The race was the biggest one I have ever done to this time, with thousands of people taking part. It was an almost flat route, except for a downhill start, and an uphill finish. The added bit of fun was that participants could choose to participate for the White Rose or the Red Rose, a reminiscence of the War of the Roses. Because the race was run reasonably close to city center, it was full of people cheering and bands, which was very motivational. ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ::: {layout-ncol=4} ![](https://storage.googleapis.com/blogs_josa/sport_small/2011-10-13_BUPA_GREAT_YORKSHIRE_RUN/img/01.png){ width="100" group="hi" } ![](https://storage.googleapis.com/blogs_josa/sport_small/2011-10-13_BUPA_GREAT_YORKSHIRE_RUN/img/02.png){ width="100" group="hi" } ![](https://storage.googleapis.com/blogs_josa/sport_small/2011-10-13_BUPA_GREAT_YORKSHIRE_RUN/img/03.png){ width="100" group="hi" } ![](https://storage.googleapis.com/blogs_josa/sport_small/2011-10-13_BUPA_GREAT_YORKSHIRE_RUN/img/orig-chaa1267.jpg){ width="100" group="hi" } ![](https://storage.googleapis.com/blogs_josa/sport_small/2011-10-13_BUPA_GREAT_YORKSHIRE_RUN/img/orig-chag0783.jpg){ width="100" group="hi" } :::
